subject: Re: Working on punie + rindolf (the implementation) Reloaded
body:
chromatic wrote:
> On Tuesday 10 April 2007 18:51, Shlomi Fish wrote:
>
>   
>>> (Although it seems the most interesting promises made by parrot - fast
>>> typeless code for example - are not going to be delivered, too).
>>>       
>
>   
>> Hmmm.... I haven't been closely following Parrot.
>>     
>
> Despite this mention, this thread is off-topic for the Parrot list, 
Though a good chance to clear up a mis-conception. Parrot is not 
typeless because many of the languages that target Parrot are not 
typeless. They are *dynamically typed*. Examples of such languages 
include Perl 6. :-)

For more on types, see the slides from a talk I gave on the subject at 
YAPC::Europe last year:
http://www.jnthn.net/papers/2006-yapc-eu-types-slides.pdf

Thanks,

Jonathan
